Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: JBlomberg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a trip to Paris in mid-March 2012 to visit our son who was studying in Paris for the academic year and to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary.Thanks to the glowing TripAdvisors' reviews, we settled on Hotel Palm Opera after a diligent search of affordable hotels. We were pleasantly surprised by this jewel in the 9th arrondissement. The staff was very professional and at the same time personable and accommodating. The breakfast, which is included in the price of the room, was DELICIOUS! Our room was extremely clean. The bathroom was spotless. Our fifth floor room had a balcony from which we had a view of the Eiffel Tower. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Clarisse
Reviews.Content: Great litte refurbished hotel, stylish and very clean. Recently reopened after full renovation. Decorated on a unique theme (palm trees) throughout the hotel: pictures, books of palm trees, etc. Friendly staff. Welcome open bar in the lobby available 24 hours with tea/coffee, orange juice and sweet and salty snacks and fruit: unique for a small 3-star hotel. Free wifi everywhere. Lift to rooms (small). Nice buffet breakfast: small but very varied including boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, French cheeses, fruits, variety of yogurts and breads, pastries, dry fruits and including some organic products (I recall breads, croissants, yogurts). Rooms are small but nicely decorated, nice wood furniture. Soft lighting, safety deposit box, Ipad dock, AC. Good matress. I have tried many 3-star hotels for work in Paris, and this is now my favourite one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ElaineWal
Reviews.Content: Returning to Paris for 35 year anniversary & we were well pleased with this hotel. They made us very welcome & the free drinks & snacks were very welcome after long days sightseeing. The room was a decent size, quiet and spotless (and we are fussy!). The shower room was modern and of a reasonable size. There are a couple of nice places close by to eat in the evening & the hotel is within easy walking distance of the Gare du Nord. We will return again but hopefully in less than 35 years this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: PaddyTraveller07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights recently, as with majority of previous reviews, this hotel is accessible, clean very comfortable, good breakfast (included in rate), free 'mini bar' in lobby, staff professional and courteous and room rate is very good value for money. I will use this as my base in Paris from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in a pretty grubby area”
Reviews.Author: camilla f
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for valentines day, got the Eurostar and was a 10 minute stroll from station very good location if you intend to get Eurostar. Metro was only 5 minute walk from hotel and got you everywhere. Hotel is probably as central as any but if you are expecting to walk out and be in the middle of the parisian main sights, shopping and restaurants this isn't the hotel for you. Staff were friendly if a bit blunt, the room was absolutely tiny but clean. Bed Rock hard and thin mattress. Had a distant "view" of the eiffel tower, from the balcony outside if you craned your neck !! Lovely powerful shower and really nice boutique feel to hotel. Not the best I've stayed in by a long long way but also very pleasant and good value for money. There's a "help yourself" fridge for guests in the lobby with drinks you can take after a long day out, snacks and tea/coffee- really nice touch. One hint, if you plan to have a late night and want to come in to the hotel after hours or perhaps need to go down to the lobby for a Bottle of water you will be met by a vile night staff man, beware !

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ariella8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palm opera hotel few days ago. A perfect find. - Extremely clean room, shower was really sparkling with shining GROHE taps. - Great friendly service. - Perfect location, 10 min. Walk to Gare Du Nord or 2 min. To Cadet Metro. - Very good breakfast, more than enough for us. - A harmony of comfort and clean style design, very pleasant.. - Free WIFI, a bit slow though. - Complimentary bar in the evenings with some beverages, snacks & fruits in the lobby. Overall an excellent experience, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times now when I have been in Paris and really like it. It is walking distance for me from the Euro Star. And after that close to transport for getting around. The hotel itself is small but perfectly formed. Has great wifi links for business. The staff are friendly. Rooms are neat and clean. On both occasions I have had street facing rooms and have been undisturbed by any street noise. The continental breakfast is adequate to get you up and going for the day. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: PhilH1
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows that Parisian hotel rooms are small, and the one's in this hotel are no exception. That said the rooms are adequate and clean. The bed was large and comfortable. The room has a large flat screen TV mounted on the wall. With some difficulty and small hands you can plug in a HDMI device to play personal video through the TV. The bathroom is narrow and this is not helped if you are on the top floor with the sloped gable roof taking up some of the head room in the shower and at the bathroom sink. Be careful you don't crack your head (like I did) when taking a swallow of mouthwash. We got a very good rate for this hotel from their direct website (under 95 Euro's a night) which beat all of the usual hotel booking sites on this occasion. At that sort of rate I would say this hotel is very good value. We considered extending our stay for another couple of days but the rates for those nights had jumped to over 180 Euro's a night! The breakfast was good and complimentary at the time this is being written. Also complimentary was a coffee machine, snacks, softdrinks and water in a small lounge area in foyer of hotel. The hotel website however states both these things are free until 31st December 2011 and I guess this might change after that. The internet is free but is hopelessly slow. You get a login each day from the front desk that allows you 24 hour access with a maximum of 200MB download and 40MB upload (forget backing up your photo's or video's to your cloudspace). The speed is shaped for each person logged on to about half the speed of dial up (~14kbps) and is so slow that some websites like hotmail will periodically crash. Free is great but reasonable bandwidth should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimtroy
Reviews.Content: Small charming hotel with clean rooms and very good service. Olivier will help you with everything you need . Ideal place to explore Paris and not only , near station Gare du Nord 8-10 min walk (you can go to CDG airport or you can take Eurostar to go to London in 2:15 hrs) , near Cadet metro station 2 min walk. A lot of shops near you with everything you need. I liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and friendly hotel in a authentic, not so touristic neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MirellaBudapest
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 6th floor, we could see the Eiffel tower from the balcony! Room size was okay fro Paris standards. Absolutely clean and well insulated and isolated room. It has been recently refurbished. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free wifi in the rooms! The elevator did not work for a day. We received a 30 euro discount at check/out. That was very nice of them. There is an open bar in the lobby. You can grab an apple, olives, crackers, soft drinks, espresso (good one) etc any time for free. That is a great idea. They served delicious little croissants for breakfast, plus a fine breakfast food selection.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome everything we could have wanted”
Reviews.Author: jojomolly
Reviews.Content: Brilliant clean friendly hotel, best sleep ever in comfy bed we wanted to pinch the pillows!!! We got the Euro Star from London, booked all through Euro Star website, couldnt believe when we arrived how close, within walking distance, hotel was to Gare Du Nord. Perfect. As we were early the room was not ready but it was about 11am and the check in was down as 2pm, they let us leave our luggage and told us to go off and enjoy the day in Paris and come back whenever we wanted from 2pm. We had emailed hotel prior to arriving as i had forgot to ask for a double room and it was our anniversary and my Birthday. When we got to the room along while later after doing Eiffel Tower etc, (we got abit carried away with sight seeing and bus tour!!!). We walked in to the room which was on the 4th floor at the front of the hotel, my fiance opened up the curtains and window and called me over to look at the most beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower all lit up. In the morning after breakfast when we were on our way out a gentleman possibly management, asked if we had a good evening nights sleep etc and we commented on the gorgeous view and he said i thought you would like that as we had seen your email, of which we thought 'Nice Touch'. Rest of the trip was amazing, we did so much in a long weekend, Euro DIsney, all sight seeing and River Cruise. Hotel was in a perfect location if we ever return to Paris this would be the only hotel that we would stay in, crisp, clean and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price range”
Reviews.Author: JamesStoker
Reviews.Content: I travel with work to Paris on a regular basis and have to contend with a less than generous company travel policy. However, the Palm falls with our policy and is clearly great value. Clean, modern, contempory and stylish, it is hard to find better at these rates. And good location. On the downside the rooms are compact, but not a problem for me. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Texjade
Reviews.Content: We were taken aback by the small room and the neighborhood which is mainly a business area. However what made our stay pleasant was excellent service by the reception desk staff (thanks Jean); the hotel's chic, modern decor; a good breakfast, and a nice soft drink bar in the hotel reception area. Our room was clean, modern and had a few nice amenities including an IPOD docking station and excellent lighting. While the bedroom was small the bathroom was a decent size. The Metro was within 5 minutes walking distance. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “thank you”
Reviews.Author: Iryna10_10
Reviews.Content: We were many times in Paris and our recent staying was very good thank to this hotel also. It has comfort and modern rooms, very clean. The atmoshere was frendly. For exemple guests can injiy some cakes, coffee, water, in a hall . Ans we highly appriciated kind assistance from the side of stuff for the organization of our airoport transfer=non-expencive and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location-Great Metro Access”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithnise
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel in quiet location. We ended up at this hotel location by accident, after having a difficult time with their sister hotel site- Joyce hotel which would not honor a reservation we had booked months in advance. However, we enjoyed the 3 days we stayed at this hotel location, and staff was unbelievably accommodating, and gave us a lovey room on the 5th floor overlooking the street and view of the Eiffel tower. The room was on the small side, as was the bath, but well designed. There is no wardrobe to hang clothes inside or stash your luggage if you stay for any length of time, just a couple of extra large pegs with hangers. Fantastic air conditioning, and lovely view from the room of the Eiffel tower My only complaint of this hotel was the safe. It is in a small cabinet right when you walk in the door. If you did not keep it closed with a code, it hits you directly in the ankle or shin bone when you walk along the small space to get to the bathroom! My husband enjoyed the breakfast bar in the morning, and as others have noted it was lovely to have a cool drink waiting in the lobby when we returned from a hot day walking for miles in Paris. Nice little hotel for the money, very nice staff & helpful staff! Read the fine print for cancellations as I am sure they are the same as Hotel Joyce which up'd our rate dramatically when we tried to cancel 2 out of 5 days when our flight reservation was changed by the cruise lines. Which is how we ended up at this lovely little hotel, but beware if you need to make changes to your reservation !!

Reviews.Title: “We will use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: stusara1
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel. Yes the rooms are small but they are clean and stylish with a comfortable bed, what more do you want. The air con worked perfectly which was handy as it was 28c at night when we were there. I did not try the wifi, i had a beutifull city to explore out side. In the lobby the fridge was full of drinks and there were snacks and a coffee machine available for free. The staff were always available polite and helpfiull. The breakfast was of a high standard and plentifull. There are 2 Metro stations within 5 minutes walk. They are on diferent lines which is usefull. We will stay at this hotel when we go to paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow58
Reviews.Content: Situated about 5 minutes away from the metro and a 10-15 minutes walk from Gare du Nor. Room was on the small side, but modern and clean, while the bed large and comfortable. A large tv with a number of English-spoken channels and iPod dock were provided. Codes for wi-fi were left in the room - a couple didn't work but were easily replaced at reception. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but visited a delightful pattisserie across the road instead. Would recommend to anyone wanting a reasonably priced stay near the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center but just normal”
Reviews.Author: stevebil1983
Reviews.Content: - Central hotel, abit far from the Metro though, you need to walk abit, might be problem with luggage - Reception was helpful, some of them maybe pretended to be (?) (it's a table next to the door, dont expect some reception desk) - wi-fi needs password from the reception every day, the initial passwords we were given didn't work but then we solved it - breakfast was normal, nothing luxurious, jelly - butter - wrapped in plastic cheeses - some cold cuts - some pastry - there is some fridge with drinks, we could get some every day since it was warm weather - elevator was really small - rooms were abit small - rooms on higher floors are nicer - area is ok, quiet / some places to drink/eat around and a supermarket Would recommend this hotel as a normal hotel, depends what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, poor overall experience”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveller36
Reviews.Content: I did not get this hotel. True, it was clean, but that’s my only positive impression. First of all, the location is not that convenient. If you want to be close to the Gare du Nord, especially if walking with heavy luggage, rethink the choice of this hotel. The Metro stops are not that close either for those carrying luggage. Since I did not want to walk up a hill with my luggage back to the train station (yes the hotel is on a hilly street), I asked for a taxi at the hotel front desk. The response I got was that calling a taxi was not possible. I asked the front desk person if there was a problem with the phone or if the taxis were on strike and he simply said no and walked way. Needless to say I was shocked by his rudeness, since the few reviews I read here about this hotel (notice that up to now there are not that many) had a different experience with their service. In addition to the not-so-convenient location and bad customer service, here is another problem: the hotel advertises that there are refreshments (free of charge) for all guests in the lobby. Well, I stayed in this hotel four nights and the small-sized fridge where the mysterious beverages where allegedly placed was always empty. And I tried during different times of the day and evening! The fact that the hotel rooms don’t have a small fridge inside did not help either. Also lacking is a place to put your clothes (there 3 or 4 hangers on the wall and the room was very small). The free wifi was slow (if it worked) and to use it each day you need to ask the front desk for a code that lasts only 24 hours. Breakfast was lame, although it was included in the hotel price. No many choices: bread, jelly, butter, small cheeses wrapped in a plastic package, the type you buy at any supermarket, a few cold cuts, coffee, tea, water and orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cosy Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nairobi75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April, 2011. Excellent, clean and cosy hotel with with interesting design. Spotlessly clean and excellent staff. They also provide lots of interesting reading materials and magazines. The serve an excellent buffet breakfast. Lovely hotel, will stay here when am in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Moments in Palm Opera”
Reviews.Author: Anastaziath
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Palm Opera in early 2010 for 3 days. We had a very good offer from our tourist Agent here in Greece and we finaly booked this hotel. I don't know how is the hotel today, almost 1,5 year later but I can express my own feelings from our first trip in Paris. The hotel and the staf was super, and the area was very lovely and romantic. The rooms were clean and our view from the room was extraordinary. I also suggested a couple of months later this hotel to a colelague and she had also the same experience so I may ask her register on Trip Advisor to write a review. Sometimes we consider the hotel from the moments we connected it with and my monents in Paris were fantastic. I love Paris and hope to go again soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neets321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and thought it was absolutely lovely. It was decorated tastefully in 50s style and was spotlessly clean. The staff couldn't have done more and the breakfast was extremely good with a selection of cereals, bread/pastries, fruit and yoghurt, meat, cheese and juices. The only slight criticism is that there are no wardrobes in the rooms - only 3 large hooks with a coathanger on each. I suggest you take a few of your own. Rue de Maubeuge is in a lively little area and is only a short walk from 2 Metro stations which are only a few stops from the centre. We would definitely go back to this hotel!! Anita, Jayne, Micky and Diane.

Reviews.Title: “modern in a retro style”
Reviews.Author: Covkid66
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is so near to the Gare Du Nord i.e walking distance and we loved the photos.The reviews were all in other languages as it had only recently reopened after 18 months of renovation so I feel impelled to write an English review.The hotel is very modern and fresh but in a 50's retro style.There are ipod docking stations in the rooms and a wall mounted telly plus internet access.The excellent continental breakfast is served downstairs decorated in an indoor garden style complete with patio furniture.The staff were all extremely helpful and spoke English and were available at all times.In reception the Smeg fridge held soft drinks which were free and a coffee machine which was also free. The location is excellent very near Montmatre and 30 mins walk from the Louvre.Our room was very small although beautifully appointed , there was only a hanging rail and shelf for clothes. In Our children's large room there were funky hooks on the walls to hang clothing but no drawers or cupboards so they lived out of the suitcase.On the plus side there were lovely toiletries and a free digital safe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful & great service!!”
Reviews.Author: Xinat
Reviews.Content: I took the RER from the airport to Gare du nord station, and from there it was a 20min walk to the hotel. The hotel is exactly like the pictures, very nice and and exceptionally clean!! The rooms are not very small like the rest of the hotels in paris, but they don't have a closet, there are only hangers on the walls. There's an iHome alarm clock, radio and speakers for ipod in the room!! Free internet. Breakfast has fresh croissants, cereal, yogurt, eggs and ham. There's a minibar in the lobby that has water bottles and juices in it, its for free!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: London7799
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel, great location, easy to walk into the city or take the metro. The hotel was very clean and the staff were fantastic... Great service and great value for money...we'll be back for sure....

Reviews.Title: “oozing with attitude”
Reviews.Author: locoman-7
Reviews.Content: We had an excellente stay at this hotel. From the moment we arrived to the very last minute. Even the fact we were given a small room didn't stop us from having a great time (as a compensation we were given 1 half bottle of champagne, some pringle & toblerone, on arrival and then again on the third day). The people running the hotel are professionel, helpful, and do care about your comfort. They are genuine and will go that extra mile. Breakfast was more than adequate - ranging from croissants, pains au chocolat, bread, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, yogurts, compotes, fresh fuit juice, fresh fruits and of course hot chocolate, tea or coffee. On top of that, refreshments are available from mini bar @ reception (coffee, minerals of all sort, fresh fruits & cakes + french newspapers and other info about what to do in Paris, and books). On our last day, we left our luggage at the front desk as our room had to be vacated for 10 am or so. When we finally came back for them, the gentleman at reception insisted on us taking some bottled water from the mini bar, as he thought that our walk back to the gare du Nord under an extreme hot sun would be an ordeal. It was really thoughtful of him, and very spontaneous. The lady cleaning the room does a great job (great art work with the towels!). The people serving brekkie are working extremly hard to make your start of the day a pleasant one. Would I recommend this hotel? Without a shadow of a doubt! Thanks for looking after us so well.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palm Opera - Astotel Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 30, rue de Maubeuge, 75009 Paris, France
